goal.ch:
1、學生對於電影中的旁白形式與敘事功能有所了解；
2、學生對於電影有研究分析能力；
3、學生能撰寫符合學術出版格式的研究論文。
goal.en:
1、Students understand how voice-over works in a narrative film.
2、Students acquire the ability of film analysis.
3、Students learn how to do research and write a scholarly essay.

outline.ch:
旁白（voice-over）是小說與電影敘事的常見手法，除了可作為故事的框架，設定觀點視角外，也可擴大故事的時間性，讓角色評論與發聲，更可以穿越電影的故事空間提供後設趣味與思考。另一方面使用角色的旁白聲音呈現其內心與主觀思想（interior monologue）也是電影敘事常見的手法，尤其用於呈現處於社會邊緣的人物或是要嘲弄缺乏自知之明的角色。本課程將帶領學生觀看1940年代至今使用旁白的代表性英語與華語電影，討論與分析旁白在片中的敘事功能。課程依影片使用旁白的類型，分為以下四個單元（所列影片為暫訂）：

outline.en:
Voice-over and interior monologue are common devices of film narrative. They can provide a frame for the story told and a viewpoint to understand the characters and events depicted. They can also expand the time and space of the fictional world, allow the characters to comment on the story, as well as take the audience to cross the boundary between the fictional world and reality to appreciate the film at a meta level. This course will introduce students to twenty to thirty English and Chinese films with distinct voice-over and discuss its narrative function in each of them. The films will be divided into four categories based on the type of voice-over they adopt: voice-over by the narrator, voice-over by characters, female voice-over, and meta-fictional voice-over. The course will be taught mainly in English to satisfy the university’s wish to become an all-English school. The films to be discussed will have both English and Chinese subtitles. Students are encouraged to use English for class discussions. Weekly journals and final paper can be written in Chinese.
